title: Tapping Canada's resources
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Forests and forestry - Canada
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural resources

description: News magazine items: 1. In the Salt Mines: At Ojibway, Ontario, a journey to glittering white caverns is shown. 2. Trans-Canada Pipeline: The toughest stretch of the world's longest gas pipeline--northern Ontario--is viewed. 3. Plywood for the World: At the largest plywood mill on Canada's west coast, strips of veneer are peeled and then glued to form plywood.
